metadata.Title: CVE-2023-25733 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The return value from `gfx::SourceSurfaceSkia::Map()` wasn't being verified which could have potentially lead to a null pointer dereference. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 110.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-25733` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 110.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 110.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 110.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine mdeslaur> starting with Ubuntu 22.04, the firefox package is just a script that installs the Firefox snap

criterions.comment: firefox package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '110.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
mozjs38 package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs52 package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
thunderbird: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
